results.title: Wonders of man's creations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great wonders of the world”.
When the urge to build conspires with a vision of beauty, man sometimes leaves behind an enduring mark. The following man-made marks are visited in this informative video: The Colosseum (Rome) ; Machu Pichu (Peru, South America) ; The Great Wall (China) ; The Kremlin (Russia) ; Versailles (France) ; The Statue of Liberty (New York city, USA) ; The Eiffel Tower (France) ; Mount Rushmore National Monument and Crazy Horse Monument (South Dakota, USA).

results.title: [Wine growing]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Short documentary looking at CSIRO’s research program in the Murray Valley region which aims to hybridize different varieties of grapes in order to create new varieties suited to the hotter Australian climate and more alkaline salty soil. Of 20,000 attempts, only thirty types have been considered worthy of further multiplication.

results.title: Zirconia: the toughest ceramic
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Partially stabilized zirconia (or PSZ) is a new development in industrial ceramics and is probably the toughest ceramic ever made. Developed by researchers at CSIRO’s Division of Materials Science, PSZ has a number of unique properties which make it suitable for a variety of engineering applications.

results.title: Yellow dog dingo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Graziers have claimed for years that the dingo is responsible for heavy stock losses, specially among sheep. The Australian Meat Research Committee responded by earmarking funds for a scientific study of the dog. A team from the CSIRO’s Division of Wildlife Research in Canberra was mobilised in 1966 to carry out the study. Across Central Australia and the East Coast, the dogs were observed, tracked and examined in their own domain for thousands of hours. The difficulty it seems is that there is no one answer for dingo management in the scientific sense for any place in Australia and any one answer therefore for all of Australia. Management will have to be much more flexible, changing from place to place and from time to time.

results.title: Wherever you go there's radio
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
A short film which profiles the work done at the Parkes Radio Telescope in Western Australia, particularly focussing on the public display there.

results.title: The Sun goes to work...at home
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
It looks like any other suburban Australian house, but in fact it’s a highly efficient laboratory built in Melbourne for the CSIRO. The purpose is to see how much fuel costs can be reduced by a combination of good insulation, efficient design and an innovative solar heating system.

results.title: Solar power for industry
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
The industrial use of solar energy and its applications in a soft drink factory at Queanbeyan, NSW. A great deal of energy is used by factories. Solar industrial process heating can save a lot of the oil used to generate heat and thus help Australia aim for self-sufficiency in fuel by the turn of the century.

results.title: Siroseeder
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Siroseeder is a machine designed to spray a herbicide, cultivate the soil in narrow rows, insert seed and fertilizer at a predetermined depth, replace the soil and press it down lightly. Normally. farmers could use four implements and make up to eight passes to do the same job. If these and other experiments are fruitful, inputs of time, labour and fuel will fall dramatically, as will the risk of soil erosion.

results.title: Robots for Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
A brief look at the work being carried out by the CSIRO in programming computers to carry out functions in the manufacturing industries. Also raises issues regarding the changing face of the worplace. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
